attributes.action: Equal NHS IVF criteria for every county.
attributes.additional_details:
I think it is morally unfair that a CCG can deny a couple NHS IVF funding if one of you has a child from a previous relationship.Every person should have the right to be a parent.
It was a horrible shock when my husband were denied NHS IVF (by Dorset) when our GP informed us we would be funded.What has made it more difficult is two county's (Somerset&Wiltshire) both a few miles from us would have approved IVF funding for us. 
I urge the government to end this postcode lottery.
attributes.background: Infertility is a heartbreaking illness any couple can go through.Made even  more stressful by CCG's criteria varying so much throughout each county.For many various reasons such as  partners having a child/ren from a previous relationships can be denied NHS funding from their CCG'S.
